level.text: Upon completion of the counting and validation process, if a recall petition is found to be numerically insufficient, the Board shall certify the insufficiency of the petition and that the recall measure did not qualify for placement on the ballot.
Valid signatures appearing on an insufficient petition shall not be resubmitted for filing in support of that recall measure or submitted in support of another.
The proposer(s) of a recall measure which failed to qualify for the ballot due to the numerical insufficiency of the petition shall commence the respective process anew.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 42 D.C. Reg. 4419, 4432-33 (August 18, 1995).
